nodes.bodyText:
What about multiple concurrenly running Quarkus instances? They might overwrite each other.
The safest thing would be to use FileLock, but this is not going to work for a directory, I fear...
This is for dev mode, so we are saying that a developer will run concurrent versions of the same app at the exact same time ? I do not think we have to worry too much about this but I might be wrong.
Ok I added a lock for the file when we create it.

This is for dev mode

And for tests, no?
Tests might be eve more prone to this. Imagine multiple concurrent builds on a Jenkins CI server (which doesn't run each build in a container).

the same app

Doesn't need to be the same app. As long as those multiple apps use the same swagger-ui (etc.) version, a clash ist possible.
Btw, we are developing a (very) modular monolith and we in fact fire up multiple dev mode instances (in different submodules) in CI because they broke too often unnoticed.
True. There is a lock in place now. Let's handle issues (if any) as we get them ?

Ok I added a lock for the file when we create it.

This is now done per file? Hm, how many files are there on average?
FileLock imposes some overhead so it would be good to limit it to one lock for all files but then again we already have the path check so I might be over-optimizing here...

openapi = 8 files
graphql = 9 files
health = 9 files
I think it's ok like this ?

I think it's ok like this ?

Should be. You don't have any runtime numbers (in ms), do you?

To reduce the overhead for "concurrent access" case, I would pull this line up (out of the try (InputStream inputStream = ...) and call continue in case the file already exists.
But this is a really minor finding.
Feels like premature optimization.... let's wait and see if it's so bad that people complain ? w.d.y.t ?
Do we see this changing with updates of UI? Maybe having it as property will be better

Nope. This is added manually by us in SmallRye. All 3 of the current UI's. In SmallRye it's the SmallRye logo. There is a 3rd one coming in later releases, style.css. That will allows users to do better custom branding
Use JarFiles.create from Smallrye Common IO to support MR jars here
